pull.title: [23.x] ci: replace Intel macOS CI job
pull.body: Intel macOS jobs are no-longer available on Cirrus.

events.body:

rename.from: [23.x] ci: reaplce intel macos ci job
rename.to: [23.x] ci: replace Intel macOS CI job

events.body:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26879/checks?check_run_id=10602206141
```bash
Setting up g++-multilib (4:9.3.0-1ubuntu2) ...
Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.31-0ubuntu9.9) ...
bash: pip3: command not found

Exit status: 127
```
[ci: Remove unused package](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26879/commits/d5ba043a6ca29f92decb0cdae9c7c7a2350e55be) doesn't make sense on 23.x  (it is wrong)
Maybe the other https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26234 commit needs to be dropped as well? (It shouldn't affect macos)
Alternatively the task can be removed or ignored. (We only backport changes that pass on the master CI, so something that breaks here but not on master for one task seems unlikely)
Backporting of 8e017f32889e9536a436f40c91f34f24bfd10525 should fix the native macOS task.

> Backporting of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/8e017f32889e9536a436f40c91f34f24bfd10525

Added.

> Alternatively the task can be removed or ignored.

Yea. If this change doesn't work, happy to just remove it. The chance of some macOS only regression in this branch is basically nil, and I'd rather remove a consistently failing just than just leave it hanging around.

author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1652785842 +0200
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1673608320 +0000

ci, refactor: Add `MACOS_NATIVE_TASK_TEMPLATE`

A native macOS task does not aware of Linux container settings, and it
does not use the `depends_built_cache`.

Github-Pull: #25444
Rebased-From: 8e017f32889e9536a436f40c91f34f24bfd10525

ci, refactor: Add `MACOS_NATIVE_TASK_TEMPLATE`

A native macOS task does not aware of Linux container settings, and it
does not use the `depends_built_cache`.
